info.title: Segdev
info.description:
Segdev is a focused application created for Segdev's coding challenge #2.

It calculates the risk profile for different insurance lines (auto, disability, home, and life) based on the customer's information.

See [Segdev's challenge #2](https://github.com/segdev-tecnologia/vagas/blob/main/backend/desafio2/README.md) for more details.

post.description: Calculates the risk profile for different insurance lines (auto, disability, home, and life) based on the customer's information.

House.description: Contains information about the customer's house. This attribute can be null if the customer does not own a house. If provided, it includes the ownership status of the house.

ownership_status.description: Indicates the ownership status of the customer's house. Acceptable values are "owned" or "rented". This attribute is used to determine the risk profile for home and disability insurance.

Vehicle.description: Contains information about the customer's vehicle. This attribute can be null if the customer does not own a vehicle. If provided, it includes the manufacturing year of the vehicle.

year.description: Represents the manufacturing year of the vehicle. This attribute must be a valid four-digit less than or equal to the current year. The vehicle's age affects the risk profile for auto insurance.

RequestRiskProfileForCustomer.title: Request Risk Profile for Customer
RequestRiskProfileForCustomer.description: request payload for calculating the risk profile of a customer

age.description: Represents the age of the customer. This attribute must be a non-negative integer. The age is used to determine the risk profile for various insurance lines.

dependents.description: Indicates the number of dependents the customer has. This attribute must be a non-negative integer and is used to assess the customer's risk profile, especially for life and disability insurance.

income.description: Represents the customer's annual income in monetary units. This attribute must be a non-negative integer. The income level can affect the risk assessment for all insurance lines.

marital_status.description: Describes the marital status of the customer. Acceptable values are "single" or "married". This attribute influences the risk profile for certain insurance lines, such as life and disability insurance.

risk_questions.description: An array containing answers to three risk-related questions. Each answer is a binary integer (0 or 1). The total sum of these values forms the base score used in the risk assessment process.

ResponseRiskProfileForCustomer.title: Response Risk Profile for Customer
ResponseRiskProfileForCustomer.description: response payload of a calculated risk profile of a customer

auto.description: risk score tier for auto insurance

disability.description: risk score tier for disability insurance

home.description: risk score tier for home insurance

life.description: risk score tier for life insurance

risk_profile_for_customer.description: request payload for calculating the risk profile of a customer
response payload of a calculated risk profile of a customer

risk_profile.description: the JSON root key containing the calculated risk profile

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: The `Accept` header specifies the media types that the client can accept in the response.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: The `Content-Type` header specifies the media type of the request payload or response body.
